intro: Hirschfeldia obtusangula, commonly known as the narrow-leafed dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, fleshy leaves. The plant produces small, yellow composite flowers that bloom in early spring. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid environments. Hirschfeldia obtusangula is noted for its ability to survive in harsh conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
